extensionDescription.message: Shorten URLs using is.gd or v.gd services

helpText1.message: is.gd and v.gd are URL shortening services that allow you to create short links for easier sharing.

helpText2.message: v.gd and is.gd are sister services, but are two separate URL Shorten. They're run by the same team and on the same platform, so their functionality is very similar. The main difference between them is that v.gd displays a link preview page by default whenever somebody visits one of its shortened URLs, but is.gd doesn't (by default it sends people straight to the link's destination). For this reason v.gd can be seen as a slightly "safer" option and is handy for users who always want to know where a link goes before clicking it.

helpText3.message: You can shorten URLs up to 5,000 characters long.

helpText4.message: You can create custom aliases for your shortened URLs, but they must be unique and not already in use. If you leave the custom alias field empty, a random alias will be generated.

helpText5.message: The "Log statistics for this link" option allows you to track the number of clicks on your shortened URL. If enabled, you can view these statistics later.

helpText5Additional.message: Visit the shortened link's preview page either by adding a dash (-) to the end of the link or by turning on automatic previews then visiting the link. Once there use the option near the bottom of the page that says "I want to see statistics for this link".

helpText6.message: The "Shorten link type" option allows you to choose how the shortened URL is formatted. The default is standard, but you can also choose lowercase or pronounceable formats.

helpText7.message: The shortened links are permanent once created. The main reason that we don't offer this is that it could be abused (e.g. spammers could create innocuous links and later point them somewhere malicious).

helpText8.message: The custom part of the URL (everything after https://is.gd/) must be between 5 and 30 characters long. Custom URLs are case sensitive and can only consist of upper and lower case letters, numbers and the underscore (_) symbol. Non-English characters aren't allowed in custom URLs (but you can shorten URLs containing them). They don't have any other restrictions and don't plan to appoint ourselves the moral guardians of the Internet, so things like rude words are allowed.

helpText9.message: For more information about these services, you can visit their respective websites:

errorEnterUrl.message: Please enter a URL to shorten
